title: Reading through some more threads about the fall of league and DQ and I realized,
body:
I realized that with all the people whom are calling the boards members vocal minorities, that they are in fact just vocal minorities of the vocal minority group.

I mean with something like 30 or 36 million players, yeah the few thousand of us on the boards are but a minority. But there are so many more of this minority speaking out against Dynamic Queue, than there are of the extremely fewer minority of people whom are defending it.

This tells me two things.

One, that with millions of players not speaking out in either case, that the actual majority of players don't really care about Dynamic at all, and just like to play the game, go to cons, and root for LCS teams.

Two, that there are in fact a much greater amount of people that want Dynamic gone, than there are of people whom want it to stay.

The vocal minority has a vocal minority basically.

Am I defending Dynamic Queue? No, because it is painfully obvious that it has caused problems, and that it isn't performing as it was intended to.

Am I against Dynamic Queue? When it comes to going up against premades, yes.

While I am a solo player, and I more than fully realize that the mistakes I make are what keep me from climbing up, It is frustrating to know that Riot has purposely set it up so that premades are matched up against solos on purpose, and that the more premades on a team, the more the game searches out higher skilled solos to match them against.

It makes no sense for me to get my mmr up by doing well and winning 5 matches in a row, get promoted, and then the game searches my slightly higher mmr out to match me against premade teams, of which have much better communication and coordination then my team, and then for the next three to five matches I lose against premades and get demoted back down. All just because I was doing well on my own.

To me this is the system punishing the player for succeeding and isn't right.

Yes I know that my teams also get premades in them, but most often they will have less premades than the opposing team, because I'm a solo player picked solely to fill in the gaps and offer a little more challenge for the enemy premades.

And before anyone goes on about my rank, premades are effecting every elo, not just the higher ups.

Everything I've said here is based on personal experience and what Riot has stated.

Solo Queue had no problems at all, and there was no reason for Dynamic Queue other then to allow three and four man premades to play ranked together, as we already had duo tied into solo, and five man teams was a queue all it's own.

And before someone says anything about trolls, lane picks, afks, and the like, that has nothing to do with actual queue, and is just a player to player thing.

Really the only good thing Riot did when they released Dynamic Queue was releasing the new champion selection with it.

Am I going to stop playing ranked? No. Ranked is my primary play mode simply because for me there's more meaning to winning.

Am I an idiot for complaining about DQ and still playing ranked anyway? Sure why not?

Riot will change it in the future. Maybe they will keep it, maybe they wont. I don't know.

Anyway that's my piece. I've said enough.

**td;dr** The people speaking against the "vocal minority" are just a vocal minority of that vocal minority. You shouldn't get punished for succeeding. and new champ select was good, DQ wasn't.

PS. Sorry about this post everyone. I just had a very bad day and had to let off some steam. Feel free to upvote/downvote or ignore this post at your choosing.

######**DISCLAIMER:** Upvotes are not locked. Everyone is free to retract their upvotes/downvotes at their leisure. No terms or conditions apply. All persons have one upvote and/or one downvote to use on this post per account. Standard Riot moderation applies to all comments in this thread and breakers of the boards policies will be dealt with accordingly by the moderators. This is not an upvote farm thread. This is not a grab at attention. This thread was posted solely as a venting measure for one person whom had a very bad day. (Work gone to hell, well dying leaving no water available, etc, etc.) No person is required to either pay any attention to or acknowledge the existence of this post. I am tired and thinking of going to bed soon. I don't know why I'm still typing. I'm going to stop now. See you on the rift.

replies.body: Posting on the boards doesn't automatically make your opinion more important than people who don't.
Never said it did.
I did though, and its true, it does make our opinions more important.
No... it just means that people can hear your opinion. Just because other people's opinions are not known does not make them unimportant.

> [{quoted}](name=Quepha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=I60ub8Pj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-06-07T15:06:31.176+0000)
>
> Posting on the boards doesn't automatically make your opinion more important than people who don't.

Of course it does... It shows we care enough about the state of the game to contribute to its development and to the community that participates in playing it. It shows we care MORE than an average person about this game. That we are the "hardcore" players. And this is the EXACT type of player that Riot specifically says the game is for in posts like the one by Rioter Tryndamere.

> [{quoted}](name=jaymc1130,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=I60ub8Pj,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-06-07T15:47:55.117+0000)

It shows we care MORE than an average person about this game. That we are the "hardcore" players. And this is the EXACT type of player that Riot specifically says the game is for in posts like the one by Rioter Tryndamere.

The vocal players opinions are going to be regarded with importance because they bother to voice an opinion, but it doesn't actually make the opinions they voice more important than the opinions held by player that don't voice an opinion.

Of course, if you are vocal on the boards, you naturally will say that your opinion is important and matters.  You might say that your opinion matters even more than other players who are vocal on the boards.

But you have it the wrong way around.  By voicing an opinion, you now have a _**responsibility**_ for what you say, not an importance.  Everyone who posts thinks that what they have to say is important.  But it's only actually important if it is responsible.
But what if I care about the game, and simply don't have any issues? Why would your opinion still matter more, simply because you're complaining about something and I'm not?

You misunderstand entirely. The players who come to the boards to talk about, and try to improve the game, suggest ideas, and generally make the game experience better all around are FAR more important than the players who do not care enough to try to influence the direction of the game in a positive manner. It has nothing to do with complaining. It has nothing to do with supporting. It has everything to do with WE are the ones who care enough to make our voices heard and improve the game. In whatever fashion our opinions and ideas may be presented in, whatever form they may take. WE care enough to want the game to be better, always, and are constantly discussing how to do so. The players who DONT care enough to come here and talk about things are the players who BENEFIT from the things we talk about. Yet they do not contribute to the community to help improve the quality of the gaming experience for all players. That is why we, the forum goers, are FAR more important than the players who do not care. Likely, they wouldn't care either way no matter what we decided here, accomplish here, or don't accomplish here. But they will benefit from our dedication all the same.

What ever your personal opinion might be, it too, is more important than the players who do not venture here. You care enough to show up and participate in the ways you believe will make the game better. Regardless of your opinion on the topic at hand, your opinion is more important than that of a player who does not visit the boards.

Okay, I can see what you're saying. However, I must say that the state of the boards lately would be enough to make someone who may have no issue with Dynamic Queue stay away from the boards despite having opinions on other things.

I don't necessarily see it as being a more important opinion, but rather just more vocalized. Not everyone is really aware of the boards. I just stumbled here one day, and have been reading ever since.

Yes... But if you look at there account and they have 2 posts there entire account, you come off less than another that has been here for a while diving into posts and discussing. Showing care doesn't stop/start when you want, It is a full time thing and I don't think people realize that. Not saying you specifically, but I see people post threads on random complaints and that is there first post... Like... You really care about this game and only now you having a problem. I have to call bs.

Personally my forum account has been used for 3 things:

1. Meme'd before the new boards about the type of people you run/ran into in ranked.
2. Argued against Lyte/Wookie when tribunal came out (and didn't give you a reason for a ban, just told you the ban was by the tribunal). I explained that in a free/just world the protection of being told what crime you're being/have been tried for is essential to protect innocent people from being guilty. Eventually they came around and you got punishment-reports. (Also argued against it existing at all after punishment-reports turned out to show very little leniency in perma-bans, a few of which were reverted publicly by riot. Another thing that went away.)
3. This normal-queue-ranked-garbage system.

While I get that people with accounts with like no posts are suspicious; at the same time you can't blame people for making a new forum account to come discuss this. It's pretty awful. I can't think of anything since I started playing that's upset as many people as this, every day half of the new trending topics are about it. And it's been like that for 6 months. And I started before ranked even existed on this game. I wouldn't doubt that many people who have never posted would make new accounts to post.

Treat every game you are in like you are facing a premade, and tell your other team members to be careful.  Map awareness is your #1 friend even if dealing with a premade.  If you have MIAs, you can bet your money they are all skype-coordinating a zerg in bot or related.  Be prepared for it and learn to counter it.  I went from the absolute bottom of B5 (tanking from B3 placement thinking the same thing you thought) to changing the way I play in solo-Q and have zipped all the way up to S5 over the course of 2 weeks.  So, I've definitely been in your boat and I've overcome.  What can YOU do differently to outplay the situations you face in solo-Q?  That's the real question.

First of all, I'd like to congratulate you. Your attitude is very mature and we don't see "maturity" in this game a lot. Amazing job!

----------------------------------------------------------


I main support, and I go versus a lot of skype-coordinated shit and it tilts me from time to time, but if everyone does their job correctly, you can overcome the premade.

Everyone on boards is crying about how they can't ranked b/c of DQ and I'm sitting here like, "No, its not because of DQ. It is because you're making excuses for the reasons you lose rather than trying to find solutions."

#Everyone, you lose because of your teammates, yourselves. Your loss was not because you played Dynamic Queue and went versus a premade. As unfair as that is, you lost because you didn't out-communicate the enemy team. You say, "how can I communicate more than them if they're in skype?" Pings and Chat do the same thing that Skype does. Instead of listening to music or chatting with a friend through /msg or talking to your viewers (I'm watching you streamers), PAY ATTENTION TO THE GAME AND COMMUNICATE

"Pings and Chat do the same thing that Skype does"

Kek.

Yes, they do.  Actually, players who actively ping are probably map aware anyway.  It doesn't take long to see a red ! and know something is up in that area.  To vocalize it can be more cumbersome, and most people in chat are too distracted by their socializing I've noticed.  I had a kid I play with want to hop on skype yesterday, and as we were playing, I was like, "Dude, shut up!  Just ping.  You talk too much."  True stories.

There's no such thing as talk/typing too much, It's more communication.

And yes, I would like to use the ping system but.....

*Dies*

"?" ping x 10000000

People that are on voice chat ping as well and often more.  I have played almost exclusively solo q with some duo and half of that was a duo partner that invited me after a game they randomly played with me. We won 3 in a row and weren't on voice chat of any kind.

I'm higher rank now than in any season before.  I have been in games where my team has a duo and 3 solos which is no different than last season and the opposing team accuses us of being a 4 or 5 man on Skype lol.

Why because we had some people who used pings and understood what to do and when.  People get beat and instantly think..."God damn dynamic queue premade!!" 

And it honestly doesn't happen that often.  The random times I've played with premades as a solo player I have not had a problem.  A couple of times I have a carried a premade.

In my opinion the people complaining about dq would be complaining about trolls, feeders, afks, toxic people if we had soloq. Because they are going to complain about something on the boards when they go on a losing streak or lose a promos again.

And it may have issues in high elo but that is because of the limited player pool.  This game isn't perfect but I find games more enjoyable overall this season based on my gameplay experience.

Thank you.  Great points.  It really does come down to you.  Not always.  You can't carry every game every time, but if you're playing your character really well, punishing mistakes, and avoiding making them, you'll will at least 50% of the time.  True stories.

Ping and chats do not do the same thing that skype does. Skype is faster, allows more specific communication(There's no ping for "warded" for example; You'd have to type it out, as well as relay the location to any gankers, which means you have to type it out). Going premade gets rid of the clashing that people do in solo Q. If a jgler is in a premade, you won't get the AFK farming jgl unless the premade wants him too. The jgler will give you buffs when you want, etc.

You want a cheese comp? Premades can do it, without any conflict. You do it in solo Q? "get out fking troll"

A lot of people don't want to communicate, no matter how much you reach out to them. Premading gets rid of this, and gives them an innate boost which cannot be matched no matter what.

> Ping and chats do not do the same thing that skype does. Skype is faster, allows more specific communication(There's no ping for "warded" for example; You'd have to type it out, as well as relay the location to any gankers, which means you have to type it out). 

I type extremely fast (a skill you need for this game, imo) so quick communication isn't a problem for me.


> Going premade gets rid of the clashing that people do in solo Q. If a jgler is in a premade, you won't get the AFK farming jgl unless the premade wants him too. The jgler will give you buffs when you want, etc.

Once again, it's not the premade's advantage. It's your team's willingness to coordinate. Riot gives us opportunity during that long champion select. You can type your little manifesto out in queue while you're waiting and then paste it in champion select chat every game if you want a specific set-up. Then it is up to them to trust you, and if they don't want to then that is their right. 


> A lot of people don't want to communicate, no matter how much you reach out to them. Premading gets rid of this, and gives them an innate boost which cannot be matched no matter what.

Its no different than getting bad players on your team. You just have to hope for ppl who want to communicate.


I'm not saying Dynamic Queue isn't heavily flawed because it is. But if you're going to make excuses (and I know you were just simply replying to what I wrote so I'm not talking directly to you, but the community as whole) how are you going to climb?** Until Riot gets numerical evidence that DQ isn't satisfying the rest of the community, that is when they might (most likely) will revert to Solo Queue.**
Knowing this community, that wont be soon. We're slow and sluggish and not proactive on something this wide-scale (Its too wide of a scale to be honest). DQ is going to be here for a while, so until it changes, take control and become a master of communication.

> I type extremely fast (a skill you need for this game, imo) so quick communication isn't a problem for me.

So do I. But when I type, no matter how fast I type: "stop typing and play."

> Once again, it's not the premade's advantage. It's your team's willingness to coordinate. Riot gives us opportunity during that long champion select. You can type your little manifesto out in queue while you're waiting and then paste it in champion select chat every game if you want a specific set-up. Then it is up to them to trust you, and if they don't want to then that is their right.

It **is** a premade advantage. In a premade they will automatically be able to coordinate, and you have a lot more influence over them. You have little to no influence or power over the trolling Disco Nunu(which doesn't exist anymore, but you get the idea). You have limited time during champ select. You have infinite time with premades,and can plan before champ select happens. Premades don't have to type a manifesto, so we have to. What's the guarantee that they'll listen and cooperate like premades do?

There's also a limit to the amount of characters you can put in at a time; You'll have to type the manifesto on another document, and keep copy+pasting it in intervals.

It's up to them to cooperate. So when you get a team with 4 other soloers, it's a gamble. No influence, they  can do whatever they want.

You go premade with 4 other people,the gamble becomes guaranteed cooperation, and even more teamwork and communication  than if you had a solo team that did try to cooperate.


> Its no different than getting bad players on your team. You just have to hope for ppl who want to communicate.

Another thing. In solo Q, you have the random chance to have bad players. If you premade(I assume you premade to win), you are guaranteed to not have a bad player.

If you get matched with 4 other solo que players , 4 of them could be bad. The opposing side has a 3 man premade; 3 of them aren't going to be "bad" because they group together to win. This doesn't account for the elo boosting that happens a lot. Riot actually supports this. At least, they have no issues with watching  a Platinum Rengar main  smurf boosting his viewers on twitch.

>  But if you're going to make excuses

There's a difference between flaws in the system and excuses. These are flaws in the system; Being in a premade gives you a significant advantage over nonpremades. It's a fact. 

> Until Riot gets numerical evidence that DQ isn't satisfying the rest of the community, that is when they might (most likely) will revert to Solo Queue.

They won't do that. They had one biased survey, that's it. No update. When was the last time they counter their playerbase? It's been a while since that too. There have been a large sum of surveys which point towards SoloQ being more popular. The recent roundtable discussion by Riot is another example of DynaQ being less popular; It's the only recent official Riot video that has had that kind of dislike: like ratio. They can pull the numbers out of their hats, and people will suck it up. On the other hand, the surveys used by the playerbase have their methodology more laid out, so it's less manipulative. 

Dude. Anti DynaQ has roused the greatest amount of animosity and players, despite their lack of power have tried everything they can; Petitions, numerical data, arguing, debates, pro players debating on Riot, trying to get everyone to quit playing ranked(the increased queue times are noticeable, especially at higher elos). Pro players have just abandoned Riot's servers to play on their own.

Once again, trying to communicate. Not everyone wants to communicate.

> So do I. But when I type, no matter how fast I type: "stop typing and play."

Just another reason why the unwillingness to communicate is the real reason people are losing games despite the disadvantages of dynamic queue. A premade team can only do so much. If one of them has a rough lane or if more than 2 of them are feeding, the game should end quick.

> It is a premade advantage. In a premade they will automatically be able to coordinate, and you have a lot more influence over them. You have little to no influence or power over the trolling Disco Nunu(which doesn't exist anymore, but you get the idea). You have limited time during champ select. You have infinite time with premades,and can plan before champ select happens. Premades don't have to type a manifesto, so we have to. What's the guarantee that they'll listen and cooperate like premades do?

I **know** that premades do get an advantage but if you look at it that way, you wont get anything done as a solo player. It is still possible to climb and many solo players have given up over this. Trust me, I know premades have advantages. They get to practice team comps and cheese strategies but that still doesn't mean they cannot feed or that you cannot out-communicate them. 


> If you get matched with 4 other solo que players , 4 of them could be bad. The opposing side has a 3 man premade; 3 of them aren't going to be "bad" because they group together to win. This doesn't account for the elo boosting that happens a lot. Riot actually supports this. At least, they have no issues with watching a Platinum Rengar main smurf boosting his viewers on twitch.

I honestly cannot respond to that. You got me there :(

I just wanted to make it clear that I do not like Dyanmic Queue but if I sit around and mope about how it is the reason that I've been demoted more than 15 times in Platinum then I wont get anything done. 

Finally I will say this, "Not everyone wants to communicate" wont cut it in a team game.

> Just another reason why the unwillingness to communicate is the real reason people are losing games despite the disadvantages of dynamic queue. A premade team can only do so much. If one of them has a rough lane or if more than 2 of them are feeding, the game should end quick.

Premades have access to voice chat to deal with the slowness of typing. The last part applies to all teams, of any kind, no matter whether or not they are premade.

> I know that premades do get an advantage but if you look at it that way, you wont get anything done as a solo player. It is still possible to climb and many solo players have given up over this. Trust me, I know premades have advantages. They get to practice team comps and cheese strategies but that still doesn't mean they cannot feed or that you cannot out-communicate them.

I still climb, though ranked hasn't been as fun as of late(until Illaoi buffs), not only DynaQ(which does still bring a lot of toxicity), but also because of the drastic changes that have been occurign this season. It's possible to outcommunicate them, but it happens very rarely
PS:  My solo games tend to go way better than my premade duo+ games.  Bear that in mind.

Your problem lies in assuming that people that aren't talking don't care about Dynamic Queue. This is not necessarily true; people that aren't talking just don't care to voice their opinion. They might be pro dynamic queue, anti dynamic queue, or neutral on it, but they don't care enough in any case to voice their opinion.

Plus, people tend to go on forums and complain more than they go on forums and talk about how cool the game is.

First off there could be more defending DQ then people speaking out on it on boards. Thing is most people do not post their like/love of something like this. So that will lead to showing more people against it then in favor of it on boards. Another thing is given the number of dislike post on a subject, people that are in of  favor it again feel like they're beating a dead horse. It feels silly trying to shed light onto others who are going to hate everything you say since you did not agree with them across so many posts. So for people like myself I post here and there to really silly posts about DQ, but I am in favor of it. 

That is real majority of players. The case for DQ the real number of players DQ is targeted at favor or simply do not care. Lets face it they're there to play with friends and have fun, Riot is trying to get them another sense of enjoyment through rank play.

The amount of premades you say you face after winning 5 games is stupid high. Or it was the same number of people as in old soloq. I see the same people often, and yet to see the same premade 3+ in a game. Speaking of my own odds, it still feels the same as soloq. Getting the same duo in the game on one team or another. Out of the 2 games I have played solo vs 4+ the games were much easier. Even if they could talk, they were still easy to kill as support blitz. As I stated above already, this is so old typing this out. People have to remember League is a team based game, it should be a skill you improve at even when soloq. You should have some skills how to act like a team mate to randoms. Team work is a skill on its own, watching minimap alerting others of what is going on. Assist team members with roams/teleports. Just because you can talk to someone does not mean you gain the team work skill set.

For premades on your side or on other team, most people remember losses more then wins in ranked matches. Unless some funny or crazy thing happen on a win, I know I mainly forget about that game. Though I can count the number of games I lost in a day due to someone afk,dc, someone losing lane bad, crazy bad call, etc. etc.. Those are the games you want to remember though, you simply do not say GG bad game and go on to next. Something bad happened here which cased the loss. If you can find a way to fix it, odds are you win more. Simply put learn from mistakes. 

How did soloq have no problems... It had problems that Riot is trying to address with DQ. I had friends that refused to play league because of how bad soloq was. They only did rank 3/5 because they felt soloq was just stupid thing to be in place. Then there is another problem you pointed out. What if you have 4 people? Are you forever stuck playing nonranked games? How often was rank 3/5 really played? I know I never touched them for years on end. Even when I had 5+ friends playing with me. Making a rank 5s team just seemed like a waste of time.

I feel bad because really don't want to come off sounding like attacking you. It is really just myself trying to bring other points into what is being said. So that people can understand what they're saying better.

You're not attacking me at all. You are simply expressing your own thoughts on the matter and that is part of what the forums are for.

As I said in the post, I was having a really bad day and was just simply venting.

Is my post accurate? I don't know.

But what I do know is that with Dynamic Queue, I've been learning how to play against premades, which has led me to win more matches than lose, unlike back before DQ.
